What's this? A letter? (sigh) ot: :  Oh no. No, no. Where did you get this?
ot: :  And all this time, I've been ashamed of me father. I thought he abandoned us.
Line28.FD0E3: And this? Wait--I've seen something like this before. An amulet imbued with druidic power.
Line30.FD0E3: This is a relic...f-from when I was a child, when our people still practiced the old ways. Ah but I fear now I--I've not the ability to use it.
Line32.FD0E3: Unless...c-could you use it? Me father wouldn't have wanted it collecting dust on a shelf.
Line34.FD0E3: I wish Mum was here to see...well, at least now her spirit can rest easy. Thank you, friend.
Line38.FD0E3: Who's asking? Ah...apologies, wanderer. Do you need something?
VoiceDir14.FD0E3: At first, he's no sure what he's being handed. As he reads part of the letter aloud, he grows disbelieving.
VoiceDir16.FD0E3: Continuing to read part of a letter aloud, he then confesses he's always been bitter and ashamed of his background. He thought his father left his family; this letter is revealing he got lost at sea.
VoiceDir28.FD0E3: With recognition, he descibes the item the player is handing him, though he hasn't seen it in decades.
VoiceDir32.FD0E3: Realizing, as he gets an idea, then hopeful.
VoiceDir38.FD0E3: Defensive, before catching himself and softening. Life has made him jaded but he tries not to let it.
